paper.title: Bayesian component selection in multi-response hierarchical structured additive models with an application to clinical workload prediction in patient-centered medical homes
paper.abstract: Motivated by a large health care data obtained from the U.S. Veterans Health Administration (VHA), we develop a multivariate version of hierarchical structured additive regression (STAR) models that involves a set of health care responses defined at the lowest level of the hierarchy, a set of patient factors to account for individual heterogeneity, and a set of higher level effects to capture dependence between patients within the same medical home team and facility. We show how a special class of such models can equivalently be represented and estimated in structural equation modeling framework. We then propose a Bayesian component selection with a spike and slab prior structure that allows inclusion or exclusion single effects as well as grouped coefficients representing particular model terms. A simple parameter expansion is used to improve mixing and convergence properties of Markov chain Monte Carlo simulation. The proposed methods are applied to a real-world application of the VHA patient centered medical home (PCMH) data and help to provide a good prediction of clinical workload portfolio for a certain mix of health care professionals based on patient key demographic, diagnostic, and medical attributes.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要研究的是医疗保健领域中的临床工作量预测，使用了贝叶斯组件选择和结构化加性回归模型，并未涉及衍生品定价、金融风险管理或投资组合管理等金融领域。
